results.title: Just for dad
results.brief_description: My Dad means a lot to me. He works in Western Australia now, so I don’t get to see him as much as I used to. This story is a tribute to my Dad.
results.description: My Dad means a lot to me. He works in Western Australia now, so I don’t get to see him as much as I used to. This story is a tribute to my Dad.

group_siblings.title: Another tide: a Green Corps story
Flying foxes, scrub turkeys and lots of ticks

results.title: Home
results.brief_description: As a child home was just an illusion. Growing up, moving overseas, home became temperal and Australia became “just back home” and on returning home, nothing made sense - everything had changed. Perhaps my mother’s words that “home is where the heart is” says it all.

results.title: Flying foxes, scrub turkeys and lots of ticks
results.brief_description: The contrast from the wide open spaces of WA to the tropical rainforests of NSW proved to be a challenging experience for Gemma when she joined up with the Green Corps team for the adventure of her life.

results.title: Face to face
results.brief_description: Coming face to face with my dad after a very long absence made me realise just how much I missed growing up without a father in my life.

results.title: Beacon of light
results.brief_description: Melanie despised the fact that she came from an artistic family but eventually through their support and determination she would learn to love the world of art and indeed become part of this world she once so strongly rejected.

results.title: 3 years = Three years
results.brief_description: For Calvin, joining up with Green Corps when he was 20 proved to be a turning point in his life. Motivated and inspired by the people he met in Green Corps, three years on, he is now successfully employed, confident and making the most of every opportunity that comes his way.

results.title: Herald Sun Occupation
results.creator_credit: SKA TV, Campbell Manderson and Pip Starr
results.brief_description: During the World Economic Forum (WEF) held in Melbourne in September 2000, a group of protesters went to the Herald Sun newspaper to voice their concern the paper’s exceptionally biased coverage of the protests outside the WEF. Screened as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.

results.title: Emu Spew
results.creator_credit: SKA TV, Campbell Manderson and Pip Starr
results.brief_description: Report on the efforts of the Adnyamathanha people, traditional landowners of the Northern Flinders Rangers to stop the Beverly Uranium Mining Project. The report also covers police action against the protestors and the unsafe method the mining company are using to extract the uranium. Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.
results.creator_credit_for_label: SKA TV, Campbell Manderson and Pip Starr
results.description: Report on the efforts of the Adnyamathanha people, traditional landowners of the Northern Flinders Rangers to stop the Beverly Uranium Mining Project. Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.

results.title: The Bunyip and the Green Ban
results.creator_credit: SKA TV, Campbell Manderson and Pip Starr
results.brief_description: A local report on a residents’ fight to heritage list the Gentle Bunyip, an historic house in Clifton Hill. Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.
